English_Sentence: The mermaid came before the girl and said to her: "Close your eyes and come in here, O girl of ill repute!" She closed her eyes, went in to the mermaid and stayed there for the same number of days as the orphan girl. "What would you like to eat?" the mermaid asked her. "Prepare me some porridge with melted butter, for that is what one who still has her mother deserves." The mermaid prepared porridge of ashes for her: "What would you like me to cover you with?" said the mermaid. Since I still have my mother, I would like you to spread silk mattresses for me and cover me with silk." The mermaid spread out a garret for her and covered her with a donkey's saddle. As she was about to leave, the mermaid said to her: "What would you like to take home with you?" "The best of dromedaries and the best of cocks, that is what the girl deserves whose parents are still alive," replied the girl. The mermaid offered her a blind dromedary and a lame rooster with a bag full of scorpions and poisonous snakes. The mermaid sneaked into the bag. The ponds spoke to the girl: - "Get out of here, O girl of ill repute.
Tamazight_Sentence: Teffeɣ-d ẓar-s teslemt tenna-as: “ Qqen-d allen-nnem tekcemt-d a tarbat n leḥram u leḥram !” Teqqen allen-nnes tekcem, tekk-nn ɣur-sen ayelliɣ nn ɣur-sen tekka twujilt, tenna-as : “ Iwa mad am-tteggaɣ?” Tenna-as g-i tarwayt n wudi a istahel wanna ilan mayes !” Teg-as tin yiɣed. Tenna-as : “ Ma s kem-ddaleɣ !” Tennas del-i s leḥrir ; tessut-i leḥrir a istahel unna ilan mayes !” Tdel-tt s tbarda, tessu-as tabarda. Teqqim ɣur-s allig tra ad teddu tenna-as : “Iwa ma s kem-ssifiṭeɣ a tarbat n leḥram u leḥram !” Tenna-as : “ Ssifṭ-i s ulɣem-indeɣ ten kullu yufen d ufullus indeɣ ten-kullu yufen ay istahel unna ilan bbas yili mayes !” Tessifeṭ-tt-d s yan ulɣem aderɣal d ufullus irẓan, tettkur-as-d taɣrart s luḥuc ddaɣ itteqqsen, tili-d dig-s teslemt-nnaɣ, nnan-as imedwan : “ Iwa ffeɣ a tarbat n leḥram u leḥram !”
Tamazight_Tifinagh: ⵜⴻⴼⴼⴻⵖ-ⴷ ⵥⴰⵔ-ⵙ ⵜⴻⵙⵍⴻⵎⵜ ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰ-ⴰⵙ: “ ⵇⵇⴻⵏ-ⴷ ⴰⵍⵍⴻⵏ-ⵏⵏⴻⵎ ⵜⴻⴽⵛⴻⵎⵜ-ⴷ ⴰ ⵜⴰⵔⴱⴰⵜ ⵏ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⴰⵎ ⵓ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⴰⵎ !” ⵜⴻⵇⵇⴻⵏ ⴰⵍⵍⴻⵏ-ⵏⵏⴻⵙ ⵜⴻⴽⵛⴻⵎ, ⵜⴻⴽⴽ-ⵏⵏ ⵖⵓⵔ-ⵙⴻⵏ ⴰⵢⴻⵍⵍⵉⵖ ⵏⵏ ⵖⵓⵔ-ⵙⴻⵏ ⵜⴻⴽⴽⴰ ⵜⵡⵓⵊⵉⵍⵜ, ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰ-ⴰⵙ : “ ⵉⵡⴰ ⵎⴰⴷ ⴰⵎ-ⵜⵜⴻⴳⴳⴰⵖ?” ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰ-ⴰⵙ ⴳ-ⵉ ⵜⴰⵔⵡⴰⵢⵜ ⵏ ⵡⵓⴷⵉ ⴰ ⵉⵙⵜⴰⵀⴻⵍ ⵡⴰⵏⵏⴰ ⵉⵍⴰⵏ ⵎⴰⵢⴻⵙ !” ⵜⴻⴳ-ⴰⵙ ⵜⵉⵏ ⵢⵉⵖⴻⴷ. ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰ-ⴰⵙ : “ ⵎⴰ ⵙ ⴽⴻⵎ-ⴷⴷⴰⵍⴻⵖ !” ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰⵙ ⴷⴻⵍ-ⵉ ⵙ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⵉⵔ ; ⵜⴻⵙⵙⵓⵜ-ⵉ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⵉⵔ ⴰ ⵉⵙⵜⴰⵀⴻⵍ ⵓⵏⵏⴰ ⵉⵍⴰⵏ ⵎⴰⵢⴻⵙ !” ⵜⴷⴻⵍ-ⵜⵜ ⵙ ⵜⴱⴰⵔⴷⴰ, ⵜⴻⵙⵙⵓ-ⴰⵙ ⵜⴰⴱⴰⵔⴷⴰ. ⵜⴻⵇⵇⵉⵎ ⵖⵓⵔ-ⵙ ⴰⵍⵍⵉⴳ ⵜⵔⴰ ⴰⴷ ⵜⴻⴷⴷⵓ ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰ-ⴰⵙ : “ⵉⵡⴰ ⵎⴰ ⵙ ⴽⴻⵎ-ⵙⵙⵉⴼⵉⵟⴻⵖ ⴰ ⵜⴰⵔⴱⴰⵜ ⵏ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⴰⵎ ⵓ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⴰⵎ !” ⵜⴻⵏⵏⴰ-ⴰⵙ : “ ⵙⵙⵉⴼⵟ-ⵉ ⵙ ⵓⵍⵖⴻⵎ-ⵉⵏⴷⴻⵖ ⵜⴻⵏ ⴽⵓⵍⵍⵓ ⵢⵓⴼⴻⵏ ⴷ ⵓⴼⵓⵍⵍⵓⵙ ⵉⵏⴷⴻⵖ ⵜⴻⵏ-ⴽⵓⵍⵍⵓ ⵢⵓⴼⴻⵏ ⴰⵢ ⵉⵙⵜⴰⵀⴻⵍ ⵓⵏⵏⴰ ⵉⵍⴰⵏ ⴱⴱⴰⵙ ⵢⵉⵍⵉ ⵎⴰⵢⴻⵙ !” ⵜⴻⵙⵙⵉⴼⴻⵟ-ⵜⵜ-ⴷ ⵙ ⵢⴰⵏ ⵓⵍⵖⴻⵎ ⴰⴷⴻⵔⵖⴰⵍ ⴷ ⵓⴼⵓⵍⵍⵓⵙ ⵉⵔⵥⴰⵏ, ⵜⴻⵜⵜⴽⵓⵔ-ⴰⵙ-ⴷ ⵜⴰⵖⵔⴰⵔⵜ ⵙ ⵍⵓⵃⵓⵛ ⴷⴷⴰⵖ ⵉⵜⵜⴻⵇⵇⵙⴻⵏ, ⵜⵉⵍⵉ-ⴷ ⴷⵉⴳ-ⵙ ⵜⴻⵙⵍⴻⵎⵜ-ⵏⵏⴰⵖ, ⵏⵏⴰⵏ-ⴰⵙ ⵉⵎⴻⴷⵡⴰⵏ : “ ⵉⵡⴰ ⴼⴼⴻⵖ ⴰ ⵜⴰⵔⴱⴰⵜ ⵏ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⴰⵎ ⵓ ⵍⴻⵃⵔⴰⵎ !”
Tamazight_Arabic: ت فف غ-د زّار-س ت سل مت ت ننا-اس: “ قق ن-د الل ن-نن م ت كش مت-د ا تاربات ن ل حرام و ل حرام !” ت قق ن الل ن-نن س ت كش م, ت كك-نن غور-س ن اي لليغ نن غور-س ن ت ككا تووجيلت, ت ننا-اس : “ يوا ماد ام-تت ڭڭاغ?” ت ننا-اس ڭ-ي تاروايت ن وودي ا يستاه ل واننا يلان ماي س !” ت ڭ-اس تين ييغ د. ت ننا-اس : “ ما س ك م-ددال غ !” ت نناس د ل-ي س ل حرير ; ت سسوت-ي ل حرير ا يستاه ل وننا يلان ماي س !” تد ل-تت س تباردا, ت سسو-اس تاباردا. ت ققيم غور-س الليڭ ترا اد ت ددو ت ننا-اس : “يوا ما س ك م-سسيفيط غ ا تاربات ن ل حرام و ل حرام !” ت ننا-اس : “ سسيفط-ي س ولغ م-يند غ ت ن كوللو يوف ن د وفوللوس يند غ ت ن-كوللو يوف ن اي يستاه ل وننا يلان بباس ييلي ماي س !” ت سسيف ط-تت-د س يان ولغ م اد رغال د وفوللوس يرزّان, ت تتكور-اس-د تاغرارت س لوحوش دداغ يتت ققس ن, تيلي-د ديڭ-س ت سل مت-نناغ, ننان-اس يم دوان : “ يوا فف غ ا تاربات ن ل حرام و ل حرام !”

English_Sentence: She let her in and closed the door. The mermaid appeared again and gave her order to all the monsters: "You have my permission to bite and devour this girl without hesitation!" English_Sentence: A dialect is a form of a language spoken by a group of people. People who live in the same place may share a dialect; this is called a "regiolect". People who are similar in some other way, such as social class, may share a dialect.

English_Sentence: Deciding if something is a language or a dialect is sometimes a political decision as a way to make minority groups assimilate or become part of a nation's larger culture. The linguist Max Weinreich once joked that "a language is a dialect with an army and a navy."

English_Sentence: Japanese and the Okinawan language are related, as they are Japonic languages, but they are not mutually intelligible. When Japan took over Okinawa during the Meiji Era, the Japanese government called the Okinawan language a dialect of Japanese. This was used to forbid Okinawans from speaking Okinawan and to force them to Japanese.
Tamazight_Sentence: Tutlayt Tajapunit d Tukinawant lant assaɣ gratsnt acku gant snat itsnt zɣ twja n tutlayin Tijapunikin, maccan ur illi unyarmas gratsnt. Lliɣ yukʷi uwank n Jjappun f Ukinawa ɣ uzmz n Miji, ar tettini tnbaḍt n Jjappun is d tantala n Tjappunit ka ad tga Tukinawant. Aya tssmrs t afad ad tgdl awal s tukinawant f ayt dars, tsbzziz fllasn Tajappunit.

English_Sentence: The Ter Museum occupies the old Can Sanglas spinning mill, from 1841. It is located on the banks of the Ter, where the industrial canal of Manlleu - one of the most emblematic of Catalan industrialization (1848) - ends its route of almost two kilometers, in a spectacular river environment. The museum is a dynamic space that offers its visitors 1,500 m2 of exhibitions and a regular program of different activities and proposals for all audiences. Its objective is to make known, on the one hand, the singular industrialization process of this corner of inland Catalonia on the banks of the Ter and, on the other, the biodiversity of our river and other Mediterranean rivers. Clue games, dramatized visits, workshops, guided tours, nature activities, etc. make up its program. The Ter Museum is part of the Territorial System of the National Museum of Science and Technology of Catalonia.
Tamazight_Sentence: Rmetḥef n Ter yedwer rexxu deg umcan n fabrika n wareqqeɛ n Can Sanglas n 1841. Yeǧa ẓati Ter, mani lkanal ṣinaɛi n Manlleu - ijjen zi lkanalat ṣinaɛiyya n Katalunya i ɣa yeǧa ijjen cuhra ṭameqrant (1848) - itkeṃar abrid eṇes n can 2 km ɛraḥar, deg ijjen lmender n yeɣzar. Rmetḥef d ijjen lmisaḥa ṭadinamikect ṭic i ẓuwar eṇes 1.500 m2 nel maɛarid d ijjen lbermaja tneḍem n ijjen lɛadad nel ancita d liqtiraḥat i ṃaṛa iwdan. Rhadaf eṇes huwa daɛaṛef s lɛamaliyya lfarida n useṇeɛ di taɣmata zi Katalunya n daxer ẓati Ter, zeg ijjen jjihet, d ṭanawwuɛ n iɣzar eṇeɣ d iɣezran eṇeɣni n rebḥar lmutawaṣit, zeg ijjen jjihet eṇeɣni. Lɛubat n uxeṃem, γisitat dramatik, l awrac, γisitat ak ijjen giyya, l'ancita n rexrawat, d ca eṇeɣni, tcekkalent lbernamaj eṇes. Rmetḥef n Ter itcekkal ijjen ljuz' zi Ṣistem n Tmat n Rmetḥef Lwatani n Lɛulum d Ṭeknik n Katalunya.

English_Sentence: The Can Sanglas river factory In 1841, after the destruction caused by the Carlists' assault on Manlleu, the merchant Martí Sanglas i Pradell acquired a water concession to open a cotton spinning mill, the current factory. It was the beginning of modern industry in Manlleu and the Ter basin. "From factory to museum: 150 years of an industrial building
Tamazight_Sentence: Fabrika n yiɣẓaṛ Kan sanglas Di 1841, ɣar warni urddaj ar mani hjmn karlistas x manliw, tmmwc as aṛṛuxṣa n waman i usbbab marti sanglas bradil ḥma ad ibna mani ɣa ggn macina n unɣad n ṛqṭn, fabrika n yiḍ a. d bddu n ṣṣnℇt n jjdid di manliw, tmɣar tiwḍ ar lḥawḍ n il tir.“Zi fabrika ɣar lmtḥf : 150 n isggwusa iℇdun x lℇimaṛa ṣṣinaℇiya”.
Tamazight_Tifinagh: ⴼⴰⴱⵔⵉⴽⴰ ⵏ ⵢⵉⵖⵥⴰⵕ ⴽⴰⵏ ⵙⴰⵏⴳⵍⴰⵙ ⴷⵉ 1841, ⵖⴰⵔ ⵡⴰⵔⵏⵉ ⵓⵔⴷⴷⴰⵊ ⴰⵔ ⵎⴰⵏⵉ ⵀⵊⵎⵏ ⴽⴰⵔⵍⵉⵙⵜⴰⵙ ⵅ ⵎⴰⵏⵍⵉⵡ, ⵜⵎⵎⵡⵛ ⴰⵙ ⴰⵕⵕⵓⵅⵚⴰ ⵏ ⵡⴰⵎⴰⵏ ⵉ ⵓⵙⴱⴱⴰⴱ ⵎⴰⵔⵜⵉ ⵙⴰⵏⴳⵍⴰⵙ ⴱⵔⴰⴷⵉⵍ ⵃⵎⴰ ⴰⴷ ⵉⴱⵏⴰ ⵎⴰⵏⵉ ⵖⴰ ⴳⴳⵏ ⵎⴰⵛⵉⵏⴰ ⵏ ⵓⵏⵖⴰⴷ ⵏ ⵕⵇⵟⵏ, ⴼⴰⴱⵔⵉⴽⴰ ⵏ ⵢⵉⴹ ⴰ. ⴷ ⴱⴷⴷⵓ ⵏ ⵚⵚⵏℇⵜ ⵏ ⵊⵊⴷⵉⴷ ⴷⵉ ⵎⴰⵏⵍⵉⵡ, ⵜⵎⵖⴰⵔ ⵜⵉⵡⴹ ⴰⵔ ⵍⵃⴰⵡⴹ ⵏ ⵉⵍ ⵜⵉⵔ.“ⵣⵉ ⴼⴰⴱⵔⵉⴽⴰ ⵖⴰⵔ ⵍⵎⵜⵃⴼ : 1ⵅ0 ⵏ ⵉⵙⴳⴳⵡⵓⵙⴰ ⵉℇⴷⵓⵏ ⵅ ⵍℇⵉⵎⴰⵕⴰ ⵚⵚⵉⵏⴰℇⵉⵢⴰ”.
Tamazight_Arabic: فابريكا ن ييغزّارّ كان سانڭلاس دي 1841, غار وارني وردداج ار ماني هجمن كارليستاس خ مانليو, تمموش اس ارّرّوخصا ن وامان ي وسبباب مارتي سانڭلاس براديل حما اد يبنا ماني غا ڭڭن ماشينا ن ونغاد ن رّقطن, فابريكا ن ييض ا. د بددو ن صصنℇت ن ججديد دي مانليو, تمغار تيوض ار لحاوض ن يل تير.“زي فابريكا غار لمتحف : 1خ0 ن يسڭڭووسا يℇدون خ لℇيمارّا صصيناℇييا”.

English_Sentence: From the ditch to the industrial canal The advantages of hydraulic energy stimulated the location of new factories on the banks of the Ter. The old ditch of the Dalt de Manlleu mill was already feeding a cotton factory in 1829. From 1841, the growing demand for water for industrial uses caused the ditch to be transformed into the first industrial canal in Catalonia.
Tamazight_Sentence: Zi tarya ɣar lqanat ṣṣinaℇiya ɣarsn ɣar jjhd n waman ijj n lfaydt tamqrant di rbni n fabrikat di il tir. Di 1829, tuɣa tettssu tayya taqdint n tsirt n dalt, di manliw, ijj n fabrika n ṛqṭn. Zi 1841, mmarnint fabrikat itettarn aman, uca tdwr tayya d ijj n lqanat ṣṣinaℇiya d tamzwarut di katalunya.

Tamazight_Arabic: زي تاريا غار لقانات صصيناℇييا غارسن غار ججهد ن وامان يجج ن لفايدت تامقرانت دي ربني ن فابريكات دي يل تير. دي 182ق, توغا ت تتسسو تاييا تاقدينت ن تسيرت ن دالت, دي مانليو, يجج ن فابريكا ن رّقطن. زي 1841, ممارنينت فابريكات يت تتارن امان, وشا تدور تاييا د يجج ن لقانات صصيناℇييا د تامزواروت دي كاتالونيا.

English_Sentence: The river towns of Manlleu, Roda de Ter, Sant Hipòlit and Torelló, thanks to the power of water, took over from the old manufacturing centers such as Vic or Centelles, which, due to the lack of hydraulic energy, suffered an inevitable process of economic decline until the widespread use of electrical energy at the beginning of the 20th century.
Tamazight_Sentence: Dcurat idjan x iɣẓṛan S jjhd n waman manliw, ṛuḍa di tir, sant ibulit d turilu, dwrn dg umcan n bik d sintillis, imucan iqdimn idi tuƔa fabrikat umi ittxṣṣa jjhd n waman, tkka xafsn, hwan dg wayyar n leiqṭiṣad, ar umzwaru n rqan n 20, ℇad ibda usxdm n jjhd n tfawt di qqaℇ imucan.

Tamazight_Arabic: دشورات يدجان خ يغزّرّان س ججهد ن وامان مانليو, رّوضا دي تير, سانت يبوليت د توريلو, دورن دڭ ومشان ن بيك د سينتيلليس, يموشان يقديمن يدي توغا فابريكات ومي يتتخصصا ججهد ن وامان, تككا خافسن, هوان دڭ واييار ن ل يقطيصاد, ار ومزوارو ن رقان ن 20, ℇاد يبدا وسخدم ن ججهد ن تفاوت دي ققاℇ يموشان.

English_Sentence: From the waterwheel to the turbine The waterwheel Throughout history, the energy produced by waterways has been transformed into mechanical energy through the use of waterwheels. This converter has given movement to wheat, grain, oil, paper mills, and to threshing floors, forges and pre-industrial sawmills. The turbine The turbine made hydraulic force more usable by multiplying it. If a waterwheel gave up to 25% of the force of the jump, the turbine reached 85%. In Catalonia, the first turbines were of the Fontaine system, a model that was better adapted to the irregular flow of Mediterranean rivers, and which was manufactured by the Planas company in Girona. In Manlleu, they were installed in many factories from the 1860s.
Tamazight_Sentence: Zi tjarrart tahidrulikit ɣar turbina Tajarrart tahidrulikit dg umzruy tazzra n waman itthruccan dwrn d jjhd amikaniki s tjarrarin tihidrulikiyin. s mana a xdmnt tsarin n irdn, n imndi, n zzct, d fabrikat n rcwaƔḍ, d batanis, d ifaṛṛann n usfsi n wuzzar, d macina izi tuƔa ttqssan tafrwt qbr id Ɣa tban ṣṣinaℇa. Turbinas turbina tmmarni rxdmt s jjhd ahidruliki. mara zi tjarrar taqdint izmmar ad ittwajbd ar 25% zi jjhd n tzmmart n ssdd, s turbina tettwajbd ar 85%. di katalunya, turbinat timzwura ittwassarsn tuɣa udfnt di ssistim n funtin, ijj n muḍilu ittwaggn ℇla ḥsab tazzra war idjin mnḍḍma n iɣẓṛan n rbḥar acmrar. tuƔa ṣnnℇn tnt ccarikat n blanas n jiruna. di manliw, ssarsn aṭṭaṣ zzaysnt di fabrikat nns zg ubddu n isggwusa n ssttinat n rqan n 19.

Tamazight_Arabic: زي تجاررارت تاهيدروليكيت غار توربينا تاجاررارت تاهيدروليكيت دڭ ومزروي تاززرا ن وامان يتتهروششان دورن د ججهد اميكانيكي س تجاررارين تيهيدروليكييين. س مانا ا خدمنت تسارين ن يردن, ن يمندي, ن ززشت, د فابريكات ن رشواغض, د باتانيس, د يفارّرّانن ن وسفسي ن ووززار, د ماشينا يزي توغا تتقسسان تافروت قبر يد غا تبان صصيناℇا. توربيناس توربينا تممارني رخدمت س ججهد اهيدروليكي. مارا زي تجاررار تاقدينت يزممار اد يتتواجبد ار 2خ% زي ججهد ن تزممارت ن سسدد, س توربينا ت تتواجبد ار 8خ%. دي كاتالونيا, توربينات تيمزوورا يتتواسسارسن توغا ودفنت دي سسيستيم ن فونتين, يجج ن موضيلو يتتواڭڭن ℇلا حساب تاززرا وار يدجين منضضما ن يغزّرّان ن ربحار اشمرار. توغا صننℇن تنت ششاريكات ن بلاناس ن جيرونا. دي مانليو, سسارسن اططاص ززايسنت دي فابريكات ننس زڭ وبددو ن يسڭڭووسا ن سستتينات ن رقان ن 1ق.

English_Sentence: The canal, lever of industrial progress in Manlleu The industrial canal made intensive use of hydraulic energy possible for the first cotton factories installed in Manlleu. Created from successive reforms and expansions, in 1848 it already fed seven spinning mills. The Three Factories, origin of the industrial canal After the destruction of the flour mill of Miarons, following the fire of Manlleu by the Carlists in 1839, the manufacturer of Vic Rafael Puget, who already exploited the Can Barola factory, acquired land and water rights from the owner of the mill Francesc Mitjavila. Puget and his partners, Antoni Baixeras from Vic and Salvador Juncadella from Barcelona, did not build one factory but three at the end of Carrer Vendrell.
Tamazight_Sentence: lqanat, d nttat issirin zi ṣṣnℇt di manliw lqanat ittwaṣnnℇn tarra s tidt leistiɣlal n jjhd n waman. tdwr tmtn s uℇdar d ussiriw nns aṭṭaṣ n imurn, di 1848 tuɣa xddmnt zzays sbℇa n fabrikat n unɣad.Trata n fabrikat, djant s lqanat ittwaṣnnℇn ɣar warni uhdam n tsirt n warn di miyaruns, ar mani scmḍn karlistas manliw di 1839, bab n fabrika di bik rafayil bujit, i d yusin ad issxdm fabrika n kan barula, isƔa timura d rḥqq n waman zi bab n tsirt fransisk mitjafila. bujit d imcrac nns, anṭuni bayiksiras zi bik d salfadur junkadilla zi barsiluna, bnan maci ɣir ijj n fabrika, bnan trata, dg uḥzrur anggaru n ubrid bindril.

English_Sentence: Before the factory The manufacturing work had a long tradition in Catalonia. Wool, flax or hemp, were manipulated from ancient times as basic textile products. In addition to the work of the guilds in the towns and cities, throughout the 18th century an intense rural domestic activity was added in the interior regions of Catalonia, such as Osona, controlled by millers or merchants.

English_Sentence: The miller. A manufacturer without a factory This merchant was responsible for delivering the wool to each small workshop or home, and collected it later, once it had been transformed into cloth. They often sold the fabrics in distant markets through specialized merchants. The miller, therefore, precedes the cotton manufacturer and introduces substantial changes in the organization of work, before the factory.

English_Sentence: Spinning at home represented a good economic complement to many peasant households in our regions until the end of the 18th century. Until the incorporation of the first manual machines, spinning was a common job for women.

English_Sentence: The factory The factory, understood as a building where the tasks of the production process are integrated, does not appear in the Ter until the first third of the 19th century. At that time, the modern entrepreneur replaced the old cotton mills at the same time as the need for fixed capital grew. By 1802, there were already three cotton factories in Manlleu with manual machinery built in wood. By 1816, their number had risen to six. The concentration of work in the factory allowed the manufacturer to reduce wage and transport costs. He also managed to increase productivity thanks to the use of machines that were soon moved with hydraulic power. From 1860, the river factory, in the Llobregat and Ter, became the protagonist of Catalan industrialization.

English_Sentence: The cotton king In clothing, cotton soon supplanted the rest of the textile fibers. The advantages it offered were obvious: its ease of handling and dyeing, the low cost of the raw material, but also its optimal hygienic and sanitary conditions in preserving body heat and facilitating perspiration. For all this, its mechanization, during the central decades of the 19th century, advanced over that of wool.

English_Sentence: The machine, unstoppable Mechanization transformed the world economy and meant a spectacular increase in productive capacity. The factory is characterized by the concentration of machines and workers. In the new factory spaces a true productive revolution took place: first with manual machines, of the type of the English jenny, such as the Berguedana. Then, taking advantage of hydraulic energy with the water-frame, the mule-jenny and the self-actin. Men and women shared the productive tasks, the latter with a much lower salary.
